cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles (40 km) NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift WNW overnight, then turn northwest on Tuesday and curve northeastward parallel to the U.S. East Coast, passing near the Florida east coast Tuesday–Wednesday, near the Georgia/South Carolina coasts Wednesday night–Thursday, and offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast Friday before racing toward Atlantic Canada Saturday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Outer Banks of North Carolina (close coastal pass, not a direct Delaware landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: North of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL and North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC. Storm Surge Watch: North of Deerfield Beach FL to south of Lantana FL and Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; Storm Surge Warning: Lantana FL to Altamaha Sound GA; Tropical Storm Warning: North of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through the Carolinas, with increasing effects spreading northward along the Mid-Atlantic shoreline late week.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (currently projected under 4 inches for Delaware Valley)
weather_observation.wind: Low but non-zero chance (≈10%) of tropical-storm-force gusts late Friday as the center passes well offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; surge threat focused well south of Delaware Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain late Thursday night–Friday could total 1–3 inches, locally higher, causing brief visibility reductions and minor ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents in the Delaware Bay and nearby Atlantic beaches beginning mid-week, minor coastal flooding possible at high tide.
